result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony James Ray Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Garcia, Anthony James Ray

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission
CC: from Columbia County Treatment Court

2:50 PM Defendant Anthony James Ray Garcia in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark J Gumz in court for Anthony James Ray Garcia.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Juech states plea agreement to Count 1, removing the repeater.  Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Court approves the amendment and will strike the repeater.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a Guilty plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds the defendant guilty of the amended Count 1 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Gumz waives the request for a PSI.  State has complied with victim notification requirements. 
Atty Juech makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Count 1, removing the repeater:  Impose and Stay: Court orders 6 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 3 years Initial Confinement and 3 years Extended Supervision with conditions; consecutive to any other sentence
Credit = 113 days (if revoked)

3 years Probation with conditions:
*Participation and completion in the Columbia County Treatment Court Program
*Restitution = $612.00 + $61.20 surcharge = $673.20
*Court Costs = $268.00
*Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge = $250.00
*Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent 
*No contact with Kendall Tire & Auto, Montello, WI
*Random UA's 
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription 
*AODA and any follow-up treatment

**Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm. 

Counts 2 & 3 to be dismissed and read-in.

2:50 PM Defendant Anthony James Ray Garcia in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark J Gumz in court for Anthony James Ray Garcia.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Juech filed the information electronically with the Court.  Atty Gumz and the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties of the information.  Defendant understands.

3:47 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony James Ray Garcia appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by phone for Anthony James Ray Garcia. 
Court notes that this is a motion to modify the bond.  
Atty Gumz makes bail arguments.  Defendant gives a new address.  Atty Juech objects to the modification of bond and asks the court to deny the motion.

BY THE COURT:  Cash bond will remain the same; motion to modify the bond is denied.

10:09 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony James Ray Garcia appeared by video, in custody in Marquette County Jail.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Anthony James Ray Garcia. 
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

Atty Gumz states that the defendant will not waive time limits and request the Prelim be held within 10 days.
BY THE COURT:  Time limits not waived; set Prelim within 10 days

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.

3:30 PM Defendant Anthony James Ray Garcia appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian J. Juech in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mark Gumz appears by telephone as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Atty Gumz asks that the bond be held today and the IA be set out.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address and phone.  Atty Gumz has done an application and he does qualify; will be appointing soon.
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Juech requests a $10,000 cash bond with conditions.
Atty Gumz makes bail arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $10,000 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No contact with Kendall Tire & Auto or going on the premises
Initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
